Definition: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars. The latest value for PPG, bilateral (AMT, current US$) in Mongolia was $30,653,000.00 as of 2014. textAfterTable: PPG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$) The latest value for PPG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$) in Mongolia was $38,273,000.00 as of 2013. Over the past 21 years, the value for this indicator has fluctuated between $263,563,000.00 in 2003 and $0.00 in 1992. Definition: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less
